channel.title: Two questions
channel.description:
Question 1: If I were to autospawn a demon, how would I get it to walk. I've added the co-ordinates, I just need to change the walk type. What I'm not sure about is the walk type I'd use. Is there a different one for demons then there is for humans.
Question 2: When I kill my demon, it goes all elasticated. How can I fix this?
May have more questions to come, so keep checking.
Many thanks, Syrillia.
P.S. I looked for a tutorial for both of these things and I couldn't find one. So no flames about that please. The search button is crap.

~Rich

item.title: Two questions
item.dc:creator: @Rich_Dude99 Rich Dude99
item.description:
@Rich_Dude99 wrote:

Question 1: If I were to autospawn a demon, how would I get it to walk. I've added the co-ordinates, I just need to change the walk type. What I'm not sure about is the walk type I'd use. Is there a different one for demons then there is for humans.

Well, Great question. Although I am not the communities best coder, I will attempt to answer your question. First of all. Have you noticed in the autospawn.cfg file, there is the spawn coordinates and next to them are some more coordinates that usally aren’t used, well you can use that to creat a box, so your NPC may walk inbetween the boxes limits. Although I want to explain every detail to you… I really can’t because I belive you need to experiment and start learning better JAVA.

Question 2: When I kill my demon, it goes all elasticated. How can I fix this?

Well, you need to find the correct emote’s for the NPC… I want you to learn how to put it in so your coding skills will increase, but I will tell you the file you will use will be npchandler.java! The emotes are very hard to find and take awhile, but due to that I am about to release my emote list which is 70% of all NPC emotes. Please feel free to go there and use it, no leeching please.

Link: will be edited when i post my emote list

Best wishes in your coding future,
~Rich Dude

Read full topic
